title: One year after Zuckerberg’s testimony about violent content on Facebook, has anything changed?
text: The live-streaming of New Zealand’s mosque shooting shows how difficult it is to put a stop to such content.

title: Facebook's Integrated Messaging Plan Claims Its First Casualties
text: Here's the real reason these two executives called it quits.

title: Could a day of reckoning be coming for big tech?
text: State Attorneys General are threatening a big tech crackdown. Which names are exposed? Which is insulated? With CNBC's Melissa Lee and the Fast Money traders, Steve Grasso, Brian Kelly, Steve Chiavarone and Guy Adami.

title: Legislation Isn't Right Answer to Controlling Social Media Content, IronNet's Jaffer Says
text: Mar.15 -- Jamil Jaffer, IronNet Cybersecurity vice president, and Bloomberg's Gerrit De Vynck discuss the struggles of social media platforms to control content and prevent violence from being livestreamed. They speak with Bloomberg's Emily Chang on "Bloomberg Technology."

title: Facebook loses top executives Chris Cox and Chris Daniels
text: Dan Howley, Jeanie Ahn and Zach Guzman of Yahoo Finance discuss what top executives Chris Cox and Chris Daniels leaving mean for the future of the company.

title: Federal action against tech giants more likely than state action, says NYT's Ed Lee
text: Ed Lee of The New York Times and Casey Newton of The Verge discuss the potential government regulations facing tech giants like Facebook and Google.

title: Social Media Not Doing a Good Job Eradicating Hate Speech, Wedbush's Pachter Says
text: Mar.15 -- The struggles of Facebook Inc. and other social media platforms to control content was demonstrated yet again as video of the New Zealand mosque shootings streamed live and remained available on the services hours after the attacks. Michael Pachter, Wedbush Securities managing director, reacts on "Bloomberg Markets: The Close."

title: Facebook says it made an AI tool can detect revenge porn before it's reported
text: The tool saves victims of the unwanted intimate posts the time and trial of getting the posts taken down.

title: Facebook, YouTube and Twitter are struggling to remove New Zealand mosque shooting videos
text: Facebook, Twitter and YouTube said they removed the original videos, but hours later people reported finding versions on the platforms.

title: Facebook stock falls after the executive in charge of all its products steps down
text: On top of Chris Cox's departure, Facebook suffered its longest outage ever this week and new threats of potential regulation.

title: Here are the biggest issues facing Facebook
text: Kevin Delaney, Quartz editor-in-chief, and Michal Lev-Ram, Fortune senior writer, join 'The Exchange' to discuss the departure of Facebook executives and what it indicates about Mark Zuckerberg's goals for Facebook.

title: Tech stocks bounce back as Dow rises 200 points
text: Brenda Vingiello, Sand Hill Global Advisors CIO, joins the 'Fast Time Halftime Report' to discuss tech stocks catching up and if they think it's sustainable.

title: Former Facebook privacy advisor: It will be difficult for company to shift to privacy
text: Tim Lesko, partner and portfolio manager at Granite Investment Advisors, and Dipayan Ghosh, former Facebook Privacy advisor, joins "Squawk Alley" to discuss Facebook's pivot to privacy and Apple's new ad promoting their privacy focus.

title: Facebook's Bull Run May Be Over
text: Facebook's stock has stalled out after its big run-up following last quarter’s results.

title: Facebook, Social Media Criticized for Live Stream of Mosque Shooting
text: Mar.15 -- The struggles of Facebook Inc. and other social media platforms to control content was demonstrated yet again as video of the New Zealand mosque shootings streamed live and remained available on the services hours after the attacks. Bloomberg's Gerrit De Vynck reports on "Bloomberg Markets."

title: Facebook under scrutiny since removing NZ attack live stream
text: SocialFlow CEO Jim Anderson on the New Zealand mass shooting reportedly live-streamed on Facebook before the social media site deleted the video and the potential regulation of big tech.

title: Facebook Is Losing One of Its Most Important Executives
text: Some major talent is leaving the social networking giant.

title: 'A Bit Scrappier': How Cannabis Marketers Navigate Social Media Restrictions
text: Cannabis companies continue to rake in revenue.

title: Facebook's Product And WhatsApp Chiefs Are Leaving, Analysts Say It's Consistent With Transition Towards Privacy
text: Facebook, Inc. CEO Mark Zuckerberg said in a post to employees on Thursday the company's chief product officer Chris Cox and head of WhatsApp Chris Daniels are leaving the company.

title: Facebook’s failure to protect its users is sad: Roger McNamee
text: Elevation Partners Managing Director Roger McNamee on the alleged New Zealand gunman reportedly live streaming the shooting, the departure of two top Facebook executives.

title: Can the 'New' Facebook Hold On to Advertising Dominance?
text: Mar.15 -- Brian Wieser, global president of business intelligence at GroupM, discusses how the evolution of Facebook Inc. impacts the social media company’s advertising business and concerns about breaking up technology companies. He speaks on "Bloomberg Surveillance."

title: Government Scrutiny Isn't Impacting Facebook, EMarketer Analyst Says
text: Debra Aho Williamson, EMarketer principal analyst, David Kirkpatrick, Techonomy founder, and Bloomberg's Sarah Frier discuss the federal investigation into Facebook Inc.'s data practices.

title: Facebook Outage Underscores Risk of Integrated System, Techonomy Founder Says
text: Facebook Inc. said a change in the way it configured computer servers caused a widespread outage of the social-media network.

title: Tech stocks are heating up, here are the names traders are still buying
text: Is the FANG trade resurgent? The best bets in tech. With CNBC's Melissa Lee and the Fast Money traders, Pete Najarian, Tim Seymour, Dan Nathan and Guy Adami.
